page.title: 08EDUCATION
page.content: Ballymacrickett Primary School is situated in the heart of the countryside and most pupils travel by bus or car from a wide catchment area. There are 150 pupils, and a staff of 3 men and 3 women. Boys are just under 50% of total pupils. A meals kitchen is integral; a cook and 2 assistants prepare a hot meal every day at 60p. Half of the children get free meals. A typical menu is- minced steak peas and mashed potatoes,sponge pudding and custard. Medical and dental inspection and treatment are provided by the S.E. Education Board.
